text:
Pt. is 61 y.o. female, who presented to OSH with 4 week hx. of chills,
   nights sweats, fatigue, easy brusing, and DOE and no fevers. Found to
   have WBC 185,000, plt. 35,000, and undetectable fibrinogen. Recived
   Cryopercipitate and transferred to [**Hospital1 54**] for further care on [**2172-1-31**].
   Dx. With APML and started on Hydroxyurea, Leucopherisis and chemo
   infusion (see chart). Today she recived bag of Platlets and developed
   SOB and tachypnea. BP and HR also up. Pt. transferred to MICU for
   further care.
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name **])
   Assessment:
   Action:
   Response:
   Plan:
   Leukemia, acute (ALL, AML, Cancer, Malignant Neoplasm)
   Assessment:
   Dx. With APML  on [**1-30**]. Recived two doses of leukopherisis ,
   hydroxyurea and started chemo infusion.
   Action:
   Cont., current treatment.
   Response:
   WBC trending down, Uric acid trending down.
   Plan:
   Cont. current treatment. Chemo precautions. Tumor lysis labs as
   ordered. Monitor labs.
   Fever, unknown origin (FUO, Hyperthermia, Pyrexia)
   Assessment:
   Pt. with new dx. APML. Temp 102.2 on Arrival to ICU. Has spiked to
   103.8 this AM.  And Blood cx. Sent at that time. Vanco added .
   Action:
   Blood cx. 2 sets sent. Cont. on current abx. Treatment.
   Response:
   No Tylenol as LFTs elevated.
   Plan:
   Cont. to monitor temp. curve. Cont. current abx. Treatment.
   Dyspnea (Shortness of breath)
   Assessment:
   Became SOB with high O2 requierments  after reciving Platlets today.
   Tachypnea to high 30
s and labored.
   Action:
   Started on Mask ventilation. HOB >45. Recived Lasix prior to transfer
   to ICU.
   Response:
   States feels better. RR down to high 20
s, HR down to [**Street Address(2) 1023**].
   Becomes DOE with RR up to high 30
s  when turned.
   Plan:
   Chest CT as ordered when Pt. tolerates laying flat. Cont. mask
   ventilation at this time. ? ABG later this evening.
